meanings.definition: Move slowly or by small degrees.
meanings.sent1: The snail was inching along the garden path.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar was inching its way up the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was inching towards the juicy leaves at a snail's pace.
meanings.sent4: Time was inching forward, dragging its feet like a reluctant child.
meanings.sent5: The old car was inching down the road, struggling to keep up with traffic.

meanings.definition: Advance slowly or by small degrees.
meanings.sent1: The turtle was inching closer to the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was inching up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The line at the DMV was inching forward at a glacial pace.
meanings.sent4: The shadow was inching across the sundial as the day progressed.
meanings.sent5: The negotiations were inching towards a resolution, but there was still a long way to go.

meanings.definition: A unit of linear measurement equal to one twelfth of a foot.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the board using inches.
meanings.sent2: She bought fabric by the inch to ensure she had enough for the project.
meanings.sent3: The ruler on the desk had both centimeters and inches marked on it.
meanings.sent4: The tailor carefully marked the fabric in inches before cutting.
meanings.sent5: The map scale showed miles and inches for accurate distance measurements.
